etymology.description: Depicts flames or fire at the bottom of a character
etymology.interpretation: The character 灬(biāo, 'fire') visually resembles flames and is used to represent fire-related concepts, especially as a radical component in many Chinese characters.

examples.chinese: 灬是燃烧的象征(灬是燃燒的象徵)。
examples.english: Fire is a symbol of burning.

examples.chinese: 夜幕降临时(夜幕降臨時)，灬映出温暖的光芒(灬映出溫暖的光芒)。
examples.pinyin: yè mù jiàng lín shí, biāo yìng chū wēnnuǎn de guāngmáng.
examples.english: When night falls, fire radiates a warm glow.

examples.chinese: 狂风暴雨后(狂風暴雨後)，灬象征重生(灬象徵重生)。
examples.pinyin: kuáng fēng bào yǔ hòu, biāo xiàngzhēng chóngshēng.
examples.english: After the storm, fire symbolizes rebirth.
